turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hello? I can hear you, can you hear me? <UNIN/>. Excellent, just before I go any further, can you confirm your name and your age, please?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hi. Can you hear me?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, I can hear you now.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah. My name is Jessica Smith, and I'm nineteen years old.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And how can I help you Mrs Smith?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, yeah so uh, I mean this is, this is a bit embarrassing, but it's, it's <UNIN/> uh, hurting when I, <UNIN/>, when I use the bathroom, when I pee. And um, it's been going on for a few days, so I'm a, I'm a little bit worried about it. Uh, not sure what to do.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, well <UNIN/>, I, thank you for coming in, so hopefully we can help with your symptoms. Um, so you mentioned it started a few days ago. Um, so, can you tell me a bit more about that, what kind of pain it is, that you're experiencing?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, it's, it's not too bad, it's sort of like a stinging kind of pain. Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: It's not like unbearable, but uh, it's <UNIN/>, it's definitely uh, it definitely bothers me when I pee. Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And uh, yeah I also maybe sometimes get some like, pain kind of lower down in my tummy, when I, when I go to the bathroom. Uh, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, OK. And, and, uh, the pain in your tummy, is it, can you describe the <UNIN/>, the pain to me? Is it cramping, burning, sharp?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, yeah, I don't know maybe uh, sort of, sort of cramping. I'm not really sure, but it's not like, it's not like cramping like when I get, when I have a period or something. It's like, I don't know, <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, <UNSURE>right</UNSURE>, OK, OK. Um, fine. And, have you found yourself going to the toilet more often than normal?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, not, I don't think so, I haven't noticed that.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, OK, fine. Have you noticed any, any funny colour to your urine? So, has there been, uh, <UNIN/>, any blood in your urine? Have you noticed any other darkening of urine?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, there was a little bit of blood earlier today, um, but besides that, not at all, no. Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: It does kind of, <UNSURE>it</UNSURE>, it kind of like, doesn't smell very, it smells a bit weird I guess, um, but, no, not really anything uh, anything drastic.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, fine, OK. Um, right, let me just <UNIN/>, write a few notes down as well. Um.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>, and you mentioned a tummy pain, that also started a few days ago. Does the pain move anywhere else? Does it move towards the back, or towards your flank, the sides?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, not really, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, OK, fine. With those symptoms, have you noticed any other symptoms like nausea, vomiting?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no, not <UNIN/>, not at all.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Any fevers, or temperatures?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/> <UNSURE>think so</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>, sorry, was there any, any fevers or temperatures? Sorry, I didn't hear you.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, no, no fever, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No fever, OK, fine, sorry. Um, OK. Um, in terms of your bowel, are your bowels working OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, uh, I think so, yeah, it seems <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>So, uh, by that I mean</UNSURE>, um, any, any diarrhoea, loose stool?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no, not that I've, not that I've noticed at all.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, all right. And um, Jessica, sometimes we have to ask very private sensitive questions, uh, just to <UNIN/>, get a full history. Um, hope you don't mind me <UNSURE>asking</UNSURE>, but are you currently sexually active?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah I am.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>OK, is</UNSURE> that with a regular, partner?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ohh, yeah, so I, I've had a boyfriend for about <UNSURE>a</UNSURE>, a couple of months now, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Fine, OK. Um, have you noticed any other discharge from, from down below?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I haven't noticed anything.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, OK. When was your last um, uh, last STD screen? If, if ever?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Don't think I've ever, I don't think I've ever had one.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, OK, fine. <UNSURE>And</UNSURE>, and um.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Do you use any form of contraception, at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah, we use condoms.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You use condoms, OK. And when was your last, period?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, couple <UNSURE>of</UNSURE> weeks ago.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Three weeks ago, OK. Is there any chance you could be pregnant perhaps?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Say again.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Is there <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> any chance you could be pregnant?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I don't think so, I <UNSURE>don't</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, no. <UNIN/>, it's always worth asking uh, young females like yourself, um. Uh, um, so if that obviously you are worried about the pain.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, not getting any better, uh, then I'd always <UNIN/>, advise getting a pregnancy test, to rule out pregnancy. OK? Um, fine. So just moving on, moving on. Are you otherwise fit and well?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, yeah, I think I'm, I'm feeling OK, otherwise, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And so by that I mean, do you have any other medical problems, medical <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, medical history?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, so, in the past I've had some uh, some IBS. Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: But, other than that I think no like uh, real serious medical problems that seem, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Do you take any regular medications?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no, I did uh, I did uh, a little bit ago, or a couple of days ago, try some uh, over the counter bicarbonate, to try and help with the pain but it wasn't, it wasn't really helping.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So you've tried that and it didn't help? OK, all right. Um, do you have any allergies to any medications?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah, I'm allergic to, Clindamycin.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And what happens when you take Clindamycin?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I, I get some like a, a, a swelling, basically.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Right then</UNSURE>, OK. So it's quite a, seems like a quite severe allergy to it, is <UNIN/>, is that right? Um, OK. Fine. In terms of your family history, is there anything I should be aware of, um, related to kidneys, bladder, bowels, guts?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no I don't think so, not that I, not anything I know about.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, all right. And tell me a bit more about your home situation. Who's lives, who's at home with you?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, so I live in a, live in a flat near my college, with a, a couple of like friends of mine. Uh, so I'm, I'm not like living at home or anything. Um.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, and what <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> <UNSURE>about sorry</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, and are you a, are you working at the moment, or are you a student?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I'm a student.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, and what are you studying?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I'm studying biology.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And how's that going?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, it's good yeah, it's really, it's really interesting uh, learning about, learning about how uh, how the world works, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> <UNSURE>great</UNSURE>. Do you have any aspirations for the future, in terms of careers?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I don't know, maybe a doctor someday, you never know.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>, <UNSURE>recommend</UNSURE> it, we need doctors. Um, what about smoking and alcohol? Do you drink much in the way of, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, do you, do you smoke, or do you drink much in the way of alcohol?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I don't, I don't smoke, uh, I do drink, like on the weekends, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>, <UNSURE>so</UNSURE> socially, OK. All right. Um, right, excellent. So, um, at this stage I <UNIN/>, I would proceed to examination.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: But um, based on your story, um, just to summarise really. So, last three days, you've been having bit of burning pain on passing urine. A bit of, crampy tummy pain lower down.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, <UNIN/>, essentially but, but no other fevers or back pain, uh, if I, if I understand correctly.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I <UNSURE>think</UNSURE> probably do have what we call a simple UTI or urinary tract infection, bladder infection, um, which can be readily treated. So, I'll give you a course of antibiotics today.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Mm-hmm.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Something, called either Nitrofurantoin, or Trimethoprim. Uh, and it's normally a three day course. Uh, so, one tablet, twice a day, for three days.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And <UNIN/>, that <UNSURE>should</UNSURE> hopefully help your symptoms, but I also advise you to drink plenty of fluids. Let's try and flush that, you know, that infection out of your body, if you can.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, you can try, cranberry juice, that can sometimes help with your symptoms.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, and if you're still not better, by the end of this week, I want you to give me a call or come back and see me. And uh, we can have another look at your symptoms.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK, so <UNIN/> three days of the medication, and then wait a little bit, if it still doesn't go away, call back, that <UNSURE>OK</UNSURE>?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Yeah</UNSURE>, yeah absolutely. And things to look out for would be, you know, if you are having kind of, high temperatures, a back pain, um just <UNIN/>, generally feeling more unwell.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh, you know, I do <UNSURE>want you</UNSURE> give me a call back, 'cause then we do worry whether your infection may be spreading up towards your kidneys, which is something we wanna avoid. So, do, do give me a call if you're having any concerns, OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK, is there, is there anything like, like, should I be worried about? Like, like, not having sex or anything within the next week, or anything like this?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah I mean if you can try and avoid it, I think that'd be sensible. Um, uh, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> it's great that you're using barrier contraception. I <UNSURE>would</UNSURE> recommend you to continue using barrier contraception, but if you can avoid it while your symptoms clear up. That'd probably be the best for you and your boyfriend,<INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK, OK. Uh, that, that makes sense. <UNSURE>Ohh</UNSURE>, OK, thank you so much.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Great.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Thank you</UNSURE> very much. Wish you all the best.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, thank you. Take care.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>
